categories.title: ElizaOS Plugin Development and Integration Updates

content.text: The ElizaOS community has been actively addressing plugin integration issues and improving the platform’s plugin ecosystem. Key discussions on Discord revolved around troubleshooting Telegram and Twitter plugin setups, database configuration challenges, and agent behavior customization. Users like aiqubit and harveyjavier resolved plugin issues with guidance from tamagogogo_, who clarified correct installation commands and JSON configurations. However, some issues, such as RAG knowledge updates not reflecting without deleting the database file and agents responding with both action and default messages, remain unresolved.

Several GitHub pull requests introduced improvements and fixes across various ElizaOS plugins. The `plugin-browser` was cleaned up to remove duplicate code after being split from `plugin-node` (PR #4129). The `plugin-evm` received test fixes to improve reliability in wallet-related functionality (PR #4130). Additionally, the OpenAI plugin was enhanced to allow users to specify custom embedding models and dimensions, improving compatibility with OpenAI-compatible providers (PR #4140).

Plugin publishing workflows were refined in PR #4132, which improved GitHub push behavior, added support for `@elizaos/plugin` aliasing, and refactored code for better maintainability. Additionally, PR #4136 updated the `.env.example` file to include environment variables for the Raiinmaker plugin, ensuring better setup clarity for developers.

An open issue (#4127) highlighted inefficiencies in the Twitter plugin, where it repeatedly checks and logs already-processed tweets. This behavior leads to unnecessary API calls, log clutter, and potential rate limiting. Suggested solutions include implementing cursor-based pagination, caching processed tweet IDs, and filtering logs to reduce redundancy.

The current crypto market shows a wide range of asset values. Wrapped Bitcoin (WBTC) is trading at $85,119.08, making it the highest-valued asset among the listed tokens. Wrapped Ether (WETH) follows with a price of $1,905.85. Solana (SOL) is priced at $126.68, while ai16z, a lower-value token, is trading at $0.1954.

categories.title: DegenAI/Spartan V2 Development and ElizaOS Enhancements

content.text: The DegenAI/Spartan project is nearing the release of its V2 version, with an estimated launch timeline of one to two weeks. According to odilitime, the development team is focused on achieving feature parity with the older V1 version while also improving system stability. A new name for the project has been finalized and secured, and marketing efforts are underway to support a high-impact launch. Community feedback regarding the Spartan bot's personality—specifically its perceived rudeness—has been acknowledged, and adjustments to make the bot more friendly are likely to be included in the update.

In parallel, the ElizaOS project has seen active development with contributions from 10 developers across 11 pull requests. Key updates include package improvements such as cleaning up the browser plugin, the addition of new features like enhanced Telegram logic using middlewares, and the resolution of two bugs. These changes reflect a broader effort to improve system functionality and user experience.

categories.title: Community-Driven Token Promotion and Management on pump.fun and Telegram

content.text: The Discord chat centers around real-time trading, promotion, and analysis of meme and microcap tokens on the Solana-based platform pump.fun. Community members actively coordinate to influence token performance through floor price manipulation, social media promotion, and narrative alignment. Key figures like paulshitttt and e_turtle lead efforts to push specific tokens (e.g., aW8Y2gYyyLb9DT3pXzzLJmUBsyYvf4mysLs6dGwpump) to higher rankings such as King of the Hill (KOTH) by tracking market cap and holder count in real time. Community strategies include pooling SOL, leveraging external events (e.g., Nintendo Switch 2, OnlyFans AI), and using platforms like Truth Terminal and Twitter for visibility.

Technical discussions also highlight the importance of branding and naming in token success. For example, pmoer relaunched a token after a misspelling error, with support from e_turtle who invested early to help it gain traction. Users like shooter.rcj and magicyte contributed by explaining token meta trends and identifying narrative-driven opportunities. Rick played a key role by providing automated updates on token performance and linking relevant tweets to support trading decisions.

In terms of platform development, a new feature was introduced via GitHub to enhance Telegram community management. The update allows the community manager to greet new users and timeout disruptive ones, improving moderation and user onboarding in Telegram groups associated with the token community.

categories.title: Partner Involvement and Launch Strategy for auto.fun

content.text: The discussion around the auto.fun launch primarily focused on the project's delay and the role of partners in the process. Community members expressed concern over the decision to expand the partner list and feature set instead of launching a minimal viable product (MVP). Prudence Bartholomew Spartan III and siamese8277 questioned whether adding partners was contributing to delays and complexity. In response, delimorte clarified that the delay was due to extended testing and backend coordination, not the addition of new partners. The team emphasized a quality-first approach, prioritizing stability and long-term success over speed.

In a separate conversation, a user asked whether partners receive benefits such as allocations from the launchpad. odilitime responded clearly that partners do not receive such benefits. This was the only technical point addressed in that segment, with no further discussion or action items resulting from it.

The team received both criticism and support from the community. While some users advocated for a lean MVP to reduce risk and improve iteration speed, others, like new.moon and dankvr, supported the cautious approach. They highlighted the importance of avoiding low-quality launches and maintaining credibility. Dankvr also defended the development team's efforts, citing recent contributions such as documentation updates, automation tools, and demo events.

Several action items emerged from the discussion, including completing extended testing, finalizing backend coordination, implementing a staggered launch strategy, and updating documentation. Community members also suggested improvements such as better communication, internal go/no-go checkpoints, and protective measures for contributors against toxic feedback.

categories.title: Refactoring and Fixes for Audio Utilities in ElizaOS

content.text: The ElizaOS project has undergone updates to improve code organization and maintainability related to audio utilities. In one update, repeated audio utility code was moved to the core module to reduce redundancy and centralize functionality.
Another update fixed issues with the starter project and corrected import paths for the relocated audio utilities, ensuring compatibility and proper functionality after the refactor.

categories.title: Community and Technical Developments Across ElizaOS, pump.fun, and auto.fun Platforms

content.text: The ElizaOS platform saw active development with 11 merged pull requests from 10 contributors. Key updates included plugin cleanup (e.g., browser plugin), new features like enhanced Telegram middleware and community manager capabilities, and bug fixes such as entity sync and payload handling. Improvements were also made to plugin publishing workflows, embedding model configuration in the OpenAI plugin, and recurring task execution. Documentation and environment setup were updated, including .env.example for Raiinmaker. A known issue with redundant Twitter interaction checks was reported, suggesting the need for cursor-based pagination and caching.

The pump.fun Discord community focused on real-time trading and promotion of meme and microcap tokens on Solana. Key strategies included coordinated shilling, floor price tracking, and narrative-driven token selection. Notable efforts included paulshitttt’s push to elevate a token to King of the Hill status, pmoer’s relaunch of a misspelled token, and Rick’s automated updates on token performance. Community members used social media and pooled SOL to influence token rankings. Action items included improving token name validation, adding narrative tagging, and enabling community voting features.

The ElizaOS Discord community addressed several technical issues including plugin integration (Telegram, Twitter), RAG knowledge updates, and agent behavior. Key contributors like tamagogogo_ and hacker.boy provided solutions and scripts for recurring tasks. MongoDB was confirmed unsupported in the current beta, and PostgreSQL support was discussed. Feature requests included disabling cache, hybrid LLM UI support, and better plugin error handling. Documentation needs were identified for plugin setup, LLM configuration, and agent exposure to external servers.

The DegenAI/Spartan project is preparing for a V2 release within 1–2 weeks. The team is focused on achieving feature parity with V1, improving stability, and launching under a new name. Community feedback about the Spartan bot’s tone was acknowledged, with potential adjustments to make it more user-friendly. No code-level details were shared, but documentation updates and behavioral changes are expected.

The auto.fun launch was delayed due to extended testing and backend coordination, not partner expansion. Community members debated the merits of a lean MVP versus a polished launch. The team emphasized quality and long-term success, with staggered launches and improved documentation underway. Feature requests included go/no-go checkpoints, better communication, and contributor protection from toxic feedback.
A brief Discord exchange clarified that partners do not receive allocations or benefits from the launchpad. No technical actions or follow-ups were required.
